member.name: T:Xceed.Zip.ExtraHeaders
member.summary: Value representing the supplemental file information that is read from and written to a zip file.

member.name: F:Xceed.Zip.ExtraHeaders.None
member.summary: No extra headers will be read or written.

member.name: F:Xceed.Zip.ExtraHeaders.Unicode
member.summary: The UNICODE filename header will be read and/or written.

member.name: F:Xceed.Zip.ExtraHeaders.FileTimes
member.summary: The extended time-stamp information about a file using a header format defined by PKWARE. Time-stamp information is stored in Windows NT format and includes the last modification, last accessed, and creation dates and times.

member.name: F:Xceed.Zip.ExtraHeaders.ExtendedTimeStamp
member.summary: The extended time-stamp information about a file using a header format defined by the Info-Zip group. Time-stamp information is stored in UNIX format and includes the last modification, last accessed, and creation dates and times. This extra header stores the three dates in the local header only, therefore you don't get the actual LastAccessed nor Creation dates and times until a ZippedFile is read. The date and time preserved by the ExtendedTimeStamp is limited to 2 seconds. Though the ExtendedTimeStamp is supported, we do not encourage its use.

member.name: T:Xceed.Zip.SplitNameFormat
member.summary: Value representing the naming convention the split zip file parts will follow.

member.name: F:Xceed.Zip.SplitNameFormat.None
member.summary: The split zip parts will all carry the same name. This is the name passed at the construction of the . If the property is greater than 0, the event must be handled to provided names for each split part of the zip file. This is the value to use when creating spanned zip files.

member.name: F:Xceed.Zip.SplitNameFormat.XceedZipActiveX
member.summary: The split zip file parts will use the same naming convention as the ActiveX version of Xceed Zip. The first split part will have the .zip extension. Subsequent parts will be named .z02, .z03, .z04 ... .z100, .z101, etc. This convention is not compatible with PkZip or WinZip since they require that the last part have the .zip extension and not the first.

member.name: F:Xceed.Zip.SplitNameFormat.PkZip
member.summary: The split zip file parts will use the PkZip naming convention. The last split part will end with the .zip extension. The first will be named .zip.z01, .zip.z02 ... .zip.100, .zip.101, etc. When dealing with more than 99 split zip file parts, this convention is only compatible with PkZip.

member.name: F:Xceed.Zip.SplitNameFormat.WinZip
member.summary: The split zip file parts will use the WinZip naming convention. The last split part will end with the .zip extension. The first will be named .z01, .z02 ... .z100, .z101, etc. This convention is compatible with both WinZip and PkZip.

member.name: T:Xceed.Zip.DiskRequiredReason
member.summary: Value representing the reason why a new disk or split part is required.

member.name: F:Xceed.Zip.DiskRequiredReason.Reading
member.summary: The end of the current disk has been reached and another is required to continue extracting the contents of zip file.

member.name: F:Xceed.Zip.DiskRequiredReason.Updating
member.summary: A spanned or split zip file is being updated and the first disk or file part is required to start updating the zip file.

member.name: F:Xceed.Zip.DiskRequiredReason.DiskFull
member.summary: The current disk is full and another is required to continue writing the zip file.

member.name: F:Xceed.Zip.DiskRequiredReason.SplitSizeReached
member.summary: The split size has been reached and another file part is required to continue writing the zip file.

member.name: F:Xceed.Zip.DiskRequiredReason.Deleting
member.summary: The new spanned or split zip file contains less parts than before and the extra parts are being deleted. This only occurs when updating a spanned or split zip file.

member.name: T:Xceed.Zip.DiskRequiredAction
member.summary: Value representing the action to take once a new disk has been provided.

member.name: F:Xceed.Zip.DiskRequiredAction.Fail
member.summary: Abort the current operation.

member.name: F:Xceed.Zip.DiskRequiredAction.Continue
member.summary: Continue or retry the current operation with the new disk.

member.name: T:Xceed.Zip.Sfx.RegistryKey
member.summary: Contains a list of registry keys.

member.name: M:Xceed.Zip.Sfx.RegistryKey.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the RegistryKey class specifying the registry key name, the value name and the value.
member.param: Represents the registry key to add a value to. It can begin with HKCR, HKCU, HKLM, HKU, HKPD, HKDD or HKCC, or by the long version of each registry key root: HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT, HKEY_CURRENT_USER, etc. The 16-bit self-extractor binary only supports HKCR and HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT.
Represents the name of the value to add. If left empty, then the "(default)" value will be added/changed.

Represents the value to set. If a number is specified, then the value will be set to number of type REG_DWORD. If a string is specified, the value will be set to a string of type REG_SZ. For any other type of object, ToString is called on the object, and the value will be set to a string of type REG_SZ.

member.name: P:Xceed.Zip.Sfx.XceedSfxPrefix.DllsToRegister

member.name: P:Xceed.Zip.Sfx.XceedSfxPrefix.RegistryKeys

member.name: T:Xceed.Zip.Sfx.Buttons
member.summary: Value representing the captions for all the buttons that are shown by self-extracting zip files created with the Xceed Zip Self-Extractor binary.

member.name: F:Xceed.Zip.Sfx.Buttons.Ok
member.summary: Caption for the OK buttons. The default value is "&OK".

member.name: F:Xceed.Zip.Sfx.Buttons.Cancel
member.summary: Caption for the Cancel button that is displayed on the folder browser and can only be changed when using the 16-bit self-extractor. The 32-bit self-extractor uses the system's folder browser and cannot be customized by Xceed Zip. The default value is "&Cancel".

member.name: F:Xceed.Zip.Sfx.Buttons.Abort
member.summary: Caption for the Abort button that is displayed on the dialog during extraction. The default value is "&Abort".

member.name: F:Xceed.Zip.Sfx.Buttons.Skip
member.summary: Caption for the Skip button that is displayed on the dialog. The default value is "&Skip File".

member.name: F:Xceed.Zip.Sfx.Buttons.AlwaysSkip
member.summary: Caption for the Always Skip button that is displayed on the dialog and provides the option to always skip files that cannot be decrypted, without any further prompting. The default value is "&Always Skip".

member.name: F:Xceed.Zip.Sfx.Buttons.Yes
member.summary: Caption for Yes buttons. The default value is "&Yes".

member.name: F:Xceed.Zip.Sfx.Buttons.No
member.summary: Caption for No buttons. The default value is "&No".

member.name: F:Xceed.Zip.Sfx.Buttons.OverwriteAll
member.summary: Caption for the Overwite All button that is displayed on the dialog and provides the option to always overwrite files that already exist, without any further prompting. The default value is "&All".

member.name: F:Xceed.Zip.Sfx.Buttons.OverwriteNone
member.summary: Caption for the Overwite None button that is displayed on the dialog and provides the option to never overwrite files that already exist, without any further prompting. The default value is "N&one"..

member.name: F:Xceed.Zip.Sfx.Buttons.Continue
member.summary: Caption for the Continue button that is displayed on the dialog and provides the option to continue, as opposed to exiting, if the user clicks on the Exit button. The default value is "&Continue".

member.name: F:Xceed.Zip.Sfx.Buttons.Exit
member.summary: Caption for the Exit button that is displayed on the dialog and the dialog. It provides the option to exit the self-extractor without extracting any files. The default value is "&Exit".

member.name: F:Xceed.Zip.Sfx.Buttons.Agree
member.summary: Caption for the Agree button that is displayed on the dialog. This button usually indicates that the user accepts the terms of the license agreement and can proceed with the self-extraction process. The default value is "&Agree".

member.name: F:Xceed.Zip.Sfx.Buttons.Refuse
member.summary: Caption for the Refuse button that is displayed on the dialog. This button usually indicates that the user does not accept the terms of the license agreement and can not proceed with the self-extraction process. The default value is "&Refuse".

member.name: T:Xceed.Zip.Sfx.DialogMessages
member.summary: Value representing the texts that are displayed by the various dialog boxes shown by self-extracting zip files.

member.name: F:Xceed.Zip.Sfx.DialogMessages.Success
member.summary: Message that is displayed in the Success dialog box upon successful extraction of all the files in the archive. The default value is "All files were successfully unzipped." cannot be used in the success dialog box.

member.name: F:Xceed.Zip.Sfx.DialogMessages.Error
member.summary: Message that is displayed in the Error dialog box if an error occurs during the extraction process. The default value is "An error occurred while unzipping. One or more files were not successfully unzipped. The error code is <SfxFolder>." Only the <ErrorNumber> variable is supported.

member.name: F:Xceed.Zip.Sfx.DialogMessages.ErrorCreatingFolder
member.summary: Message that is displayed in the Error Creating Folder dialog box. The default value is "Unable to create folder <DestinationFolder>." Only the <DestinationFolder> variable is supported.

member.name: F:Xceed.Zip.Sfx.DialogMessages.Introduction
member.summary: Message that is displayed in the Introduction dialog box. The default value is "Welcome to the Xceed Zip Self-Extractor. This program will unzip some files onto your system." cannot be used in the introduction dialog box.

member.name: F:Xceed.Zip.Sfx.DialogMessages.License
member.summary: Message that is displayed in the License agreement dialog box. The license agreement dialog box allows you to display a license agreement and to force the user to either accept or reject the terms of the agreement. If the terms are rejected, the self-extractor will terminate and no files will be extracted. cannot be used in the License agreement dialog box.

member.name: F:Xceed.Zip.Sfx.DialogMessages.DestinationFolder
member.summary: Prompt that is displayed in the Destination Folder dialog box. The prompt asks the user to select the path where the files will be extracted to. The default value is "Select the folder where you want to unzip the files to." cannot be used in the Destination Folder dialog box.

member.name: F:Xceed.Zip.Sfx.DialogMessages.Password
member.summary: Prompt which asks the user to enter a password for a given file. The default value is "A password is required for file:" cannot be used in the password prompt.

member.name: F:Xceed.Zip.Sfx.DialogMessages.InsertLastDisk
member.summary: Prompt which asks the user to insert the last disk of the set of disks containing the self-extracting zip file. This prompt is used when the self-extracting zip file spans multiple disks and the last disk is required. The default value is "This self-extracting zip file is part of a multidisk zip file. Please insert the last disk of the set.". cannot be used in the insert last disk prompt.

member.name: F:Xceed.Zip.Sfx.DialogMessages.InsertDisk
member.summary: Prompt which asks the user to insert a specific disk from the set of disks containing the self-extracting zip file. This prompt is used when the self-extracting zip file spans multiple disks, and a specific disk is required. The default value is "Please insert disk #<DiskNumber>." Only the <DiskNumber> variable is supported.

member.name: F:Xceed.Zip.Sfx.DialogMessages.AbortUnzip
member.summary: Prompt which asks the user if they really wish to abort the self-extracting process, after having clicked on the Abort button. The default value is "Are you sure you want to abort the unzipping process?" cannot be used in the abort prompt.

member.name: F:Xceed.Zip.Sfx.DialogMessages.CreateFolder
member.summary: Message that is displayed in the Create Folder dialog. The text informs the user that the folder where files will be unzipped to does not exist and asks the user if they wish to create the folder. The default value is "Folder <DestinationFolder> does not exist. Do you want to create it?". Only the <DestinationFolder> variable is supported.

member.name: F:Xceed.Zip.Sfx.DialogMessages.Overwrite
member.summary: Prompt which asks the user if they wish to overwrite a file that already exists. The default value is "The file <DestinationFile> already exists. Do you want to overwrite it?" Only the <DestinationFile> variable is supported.

member.name: F:Xceed.Zip.Sfx.DialogMessages.Progress
member.summary: String used in the Progress dialog box to indicate which file is currently being extracted. The default value is "Unzipping file:" cannot be used in the Progress dialog box.

member.name: T:Xceed.Zip.Sfx.DialogStrings
member.summary: Value representing label captions and other miscellaneous texts that are found inside the various dialog boxes displayed by self-extracting zip files. The maximum string length allowed for each entry in this property is 255 characters, except for the Title entry, which can only be 100 characters long.

member.name: F:Xceed.Zip.Sfx.DialogStrings.ProgressBar
member.summary: String which is used to explain the purpose of the progress gauge that shows the overall progress of the unzip operation. The default value is "Overall progress:"

member.name: F:Xceed.Zip.Sfx.DialogStrings.Title
member.summary: String that appears in the title bar of every message box and dialog box displayed by the Xceed Zip self-extractor. The default value is "The Xceed Zip Self-Extractor"

member.name: F:Xceed.Zip.Sfx.DialogStrings.CurrentFolder
member.summary: String that is used in the folder browser to indicate the user-selected folder where the files will be unzipped to. The default value is "Current destination folder:"

member.name: T:Xceed.Zip.Sfx.ExistingFileBehavior
member.summary: Value which lets you determine the overwrite behavior exhibited by self-extracting zip files whenever files being extracted already exist in the destination folder.

member.name: F:Xceed.Zip.Sfx.ExistingFileBehavior.Prompt
member.summary: Prompt the user to confirm how to proceed with the dialog. The user can select the button to overwrite the file, the button to skip the file, the button to overwrite the file and any subsequent files that already exist, and finally the button to skip the file and any other files that already exist.

member.name: F:Xceed.Zip.Sfx.ExistingFileBehavior.SkipAlways
member.summary: Never overwrite existing files.

member.name: F:Xceed.Zip.Sfx.ExistingFileBehavior.OverwriteAlways
member.summary: Always overwrite existing files.

member.name: F:Xceed.Zip.Sfx.ExistingFileBehavior.OverwriteOlderOnly
member.summary: Overwrite existing older files only.
